description: This is a Python source file for a command-line interface (CLI) tool that initializes various project templates based on user input or command-line arguments. It handles argument parsing, project configuration creation, template retrieval, and output formatting, including support for a special mode to get the run command for a project type.

methods.name: parse_parameters
methods.description: Parses a comma-separated string of key=value pairs into a dictionary with appropriate data types.

methods.name: create_project_config
methods.description: Creates a ProjectConfig object from CLI arguments.

methods.name: create_minimal_project_config
methods.description: Creates a minimal ProjectConfig object for retrieving template info, mainly for get-run-command mode.

methods.name: make_path_absolute
methods.description: Converts a relative path to an absolute path based on a base directory.

methods.name: template_init_info_to_dict
methods.description: Converts a TemplateInitInfo object into a dictionary with absolute paths for init files.

methods.name: output_json
methods.description: Outputs a JSON-formatted result indicating success or failure, including template configuration if available.

methods.name: output_get_run_command
methods.description: Outputs the run command for a specific project type in JSON format.

methods.name: handle_get_run_command
methods.description: Handles the --get-run-command CLI argument, retrieves the run command for a project type.

methods.name: main
methods.description: Main entry point that parses arguments, handles project initialization or get-run-command requests, and manages flow control.
